alert.note: Alert for Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 31 at 11:46AM PST until January 01 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 7 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility a quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Wind Advisory, west winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph expected. * WHERE...Salton Sea, Chuckwalla Mountains, Southeastern Imperial County, Western Imperial County and Imperial Valley. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 7 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Difficult driving conditions, especially for larger vehicles traveling along roads with crosswinds. Light, unsecured objects may become airborne. Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility.
info.instruction: A Wind Advisory means that sustained wind speeds of between 30 and 40 mph are expected, or wind gusts of between 40 and 58 mph. Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. In addition, strong winds over desert areas could result in briefly lowered visibilities to well under a mile at times in blowing dust or blowing sand. Use extra caution. If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you.

area.areaDesc: Chuckwalla Mountains; Imperial County Southeast; Imperial County West; Imperial Valley; Salton Sea
